intro: Incaea yupanki, commonly known as the Andean starflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
